summary.para: Lists the values that specify the data processing mode for a data manager control (such as the or ASPxGrid).

Identifies the client-side processing mode. In this mode all rows are sent to the client. A fully functional client object model is available. All data processing operations can be performed on the client side without requiring round trips to the server.

Identifies the intermediate processing mode (a cross between the server and client modes). In this mode only visible rows are sent to the client. The client object model is available (client row objects are created only for visible rows). All operations on the data which is presented on the client can be performed without round trips to the server. Round trips are initiated only when any additional data needs to be retrieved from the server.

Identifies the server-side processing mode. In this mode only visible rows are sent to the client. No client object model is available (with the exception of some basic processing of keyboard input or focus moving). Practically each data processing operation requires a round trip to the server.

summary.para: Specifies the manner in which a partial search is performed.

The beginning of each cell's values is searched for a match. A match is found only if the cell's values starting from the beginning match the search string (the cell can contain a longer string than the search string).

The search string is searched for at any point in the values of the cells in the specified column. For instance, a match is returned even if a cell's value is longer than the search string and has characters before and after the matching text.
Partial search mode is disabled. A cell's value must exactly match in its entirety the search string to return a match.

summary.para: Contains values that specify the manner in which the control is painted.

para.para: The control has no predefined style. Its appearance is completely defined via the , , , and other settings which have to be explicitly specified.

summary.para: The control's look and feel is defined by style settings obtained from a superior . If no look and feel controller is present on a form the LookAndFeelKind kind corresponds to the kind.

para.para: Control borders appear flat with a slight three-dimensional effect. Button borders are highlighted when the mouse pointer is positioned over the control's buttons and when they are pressed. The following image demonstrates the Flat LookAndFeelKind applied to an :

Control borders appear flat with a slight three-dimensional effect. Buttons initially have a thin border. Button borders are highlighted with a slight 3D effect when the mouse pointer is positioned over the buttons and when they are pressed. The following image demonstrates the HotFlat LookAndFeelKind applied to an :

Control borders have an Office 2003 style. Buttons and their borders are highlighted when the mouse pointer is positioned over the control's buttons and when they are pressed. The following images demonstrates the Office2003 applied to an :

Control borders have a three-dimensional style. Button borders are highlighted when the mouse pointer is positioned over the control's buttons and when they are pressed. The following images demonstrates the Style3D applied to an :

Control borders have an Office XP style. Buttons initially appear flat with no borders and are highlighted when the mouse pointer is positioned over them and when they are pressed. The following images demonstrates the UltraFlat LookAndFeelKind applied to an :

summary.para: Specifies the type of status section items displayed within a data navigator.
Displays custom data. A section of this type has no default caption or automatically calculated value, therefore its caption and value should be specified via the and properties.

Displays the number of pages within the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). The number of pages depends on the page size and the number of rows within the control. Typically, the page size is specified via the PageSize property and the number of rows is returned via the RowCount property (note that the RowCount is internal for the ASPxGrid).

Displays the index of the current page within the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). Typically, the current page's index can be obtained via the control's CurrentPageIndex property.

Displays the number of records in the bound data source of the navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). Typically, this number is specified by the control's RecordCount property (note that it is internal for the ASPxGrid).

Displays any custom status information provided by the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). Typically, the section's displayed text can be specified via the control's StatusText property.

Displays the total number of rows currently maintained by the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). Typically, this number can be obtained via the control's RowCount property (note that it is internal for the ASPxGrid).
Example: When grouping is applied to the ASPxGrid control, the total number of rows is the number of data rows plus the number of group rows. When grouping is not applied to the grid, the total number of rows is equal to the number of records within the bound data source.

Displays the number of visible rows within the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). Typically, this number can be obtained via the control's VisibleRowCount property (note that it is internal for the ASPxGrid).
Example: When grouping is applied to the ASPxGrid control, visible rows are those which are not hidden within collapsed parent rows. When grouping is not applied to the grid, the number of visible rows is equal to the total number of rows.
Displays the indexes of the first and last visible rows on the current page of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance).
Specifies the type of button items displayed within a data navigator.

Represents the AppendRow button which invokes the NewRow method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance) passing true as a parameter. Typically, this appends a new row after the last one and makes it available for editing. To complete row appending, the Post button should be clicked after editing of the new row has finished.
Represents the Cancel button which cancels the changes made.

Represents the compound ChangePageSize bar button which is comprised of an editor element and a button element and can be used by end users to change the number of rows displayed within the bound navigated multi-row control (the ASPxGrid, for instance).
Represents the Custom button which can be used to perform some custom operations. Use the event (or it client-side equivalent - ) to process a click on the Custom button.
Represents the DeleteRow button which invokes the DeleteRow method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance).
Represents the EditRow button which invokes the StartEdit method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance) thus switching it to edit mode.

Represents the compound GoToPage bar button which is comprised of an editor element and a button element and can be used by end users to move to a specific page within the navigated multi-row control (the ASPxGrid, for instance).

Represents the InsertRow button which invokes the NewRow method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance) and passes false as a parameter. Typically, this inserts a new row before the focused one and makes it available for editing. To complete insertion of the new row, the button should be clicked after editing of the new row has finished.

Represents the MoveFirst button which invokes the MoveFirst method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance). Typically, this moves focus to the first row (visible row) within the control.

Represents the MoveLast button which invokes the MoveLast method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance). Typically, this moves focus to the last row (visible row) within the control.

Represents the MoveNext button which invokes the MoveNext method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance). Typically, this moves focus to the next row (visible row) within the control.

Represents the MoveNextPage button which invokes the MoveNextPage method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). Typically, this moves focus forward by the number of rows (visible rows) specified via the control's PageSize property.

Represents the MovePrev button which invokes the MovePrev method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance). Typically, this moves focus to the previous row (visible row) within the control.

Represents the MovePrevPage button which invokes the MovePrevPage method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance). Typically, this moves focus backward by the number of rows (visible rows) specified via the control's PageSize property.

Represents the compound bar button which is comprised of a number of buttons. Each button displays the index of the page in the bound control (the ASPxGrid, for instance) thus allowing end users to navigate to the corresponding page.
Represents the Post button which invokes the PostChanges method of the bound navigated control (ASPxGrid, for instance) thus forcing it to post the changes made.
Represents the Refresh button which invokes the Refresh method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxDataController's method, for instance) thus reloading its associated data.

Represents the compound Search bar button which is comprised of a drop down list element, an editor element and a button element. The button element invokes the SearchRow method of the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid or ASPxDataController, for instance) thus allowing end users to search the selected column for the specified value.
Represents the SelectPage combo box which contains a list of available pages and allows end users to navigate to a particular page in the bound navigated control (the ASPxGrid, for instance).

A enumeration value that specifies the position at which to look for the search string's value in a cell's contents.

If true, the search is case-insensitive; if false, the search is case-sensitive. This parameter affects the manner in which the search is performed only when the convertToString parameter is set to true or both the column's data type and the val parameter's type are of the string type.
If true, the search is performed in a forwards direction; if false, it's performed in a backwards direction.

If true, the search starts from the row next to the one passed via the startRow parameter to find more matches for a given search value; if false, the search's starting position is specified by the startRow parameter directly.
If true, the search cycles when it reaches the last or the first row based upon the search direction; if false, the search completes when it reaches the last row in the search area.
member.returns: A object representing the row found. Null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no matches are found in the column.
